Package org.lrdm.topologies

Class BalancedTreeTopologyStrategy

java.lang.Object
org.lrdm.topologies.TopologyStrategy
org.lrdm.topologies.BalancedTreeTopologyStrategy
public class BalancedTreeTopologyStrategy extends TopologyStrategy
A TopologyStrategy which links the mirrors of the Network as a balanced tree with a single root Mirror. Each Mirror will have at most Network.getNumTargetLinksPerMirror() children. The strategy aims to create a tree structure where each branch has the same number of ancestors (if possible).
Author:
Anonymous

      Initializes the network already having the amount of mirrors as specified in the properties and connects these mirrors forming a balanced tree.

      props - (Properties) the properties of the simulation
      Returns:
      the set of Links created (the Network passed as parameter is changed accordingly)

    • restartNetwork

      public void restartNetwork(Network n, Properties props, int simTime)
      Recreates all links between the mirrors of the network to adhere to the balanced tree topology. First calls Link.shutdown() on all existing links and then recreates the links according to the balanced tree topology.
      Overrides:
      restartNetwork in class TopologyStrategy
      Parameters:
      n - the Network
      props - Properties of the simulation
      simTime - current simulation time

    • handleAddNewMirrors

      public void handleAddNewMirrors(Network n, int newMirrors, Properties props, int simTime)
      Creates the respective number of mirrors to be added and links them according to the balanced tree topology. For this, the mirrors are traversed in ascending order of their IDs. Each mirror which still has less links than expected by Network.getNumTargetLinksPerMirror() will be "filled up".
      Current restriction: you should not add more mirrors than can be added to existing mirrors as children.
      Specified by:
      handleAddNewMirrors in class TopologyStrategy
      Parameters:
      n - the Network
      newMirrors - number of mirrors to be added
      props - Properties of the simulation
      simTime - current simulation time

    • handleRemoveMirrors

      public void handleRemoveMirrors(Network n, int removeMirrors, Properties props, int simTime)
      Removes the requested amount of mirrors from the network. The mirrors with the largest ID will be removed.
      Overrides:
      handleRemoveMirrors in class TopologyStrategy
      Parameters:
      n - the Network
      removeMirrors - number of mirrors to be removed
      props - Properties of the simulation
      simTime - current simulation time

    • getNumTargetLinks

      public int getNumTargetLinks(Network n)
      Returns the number of links the network should have. For a minimum spanning tree the links per mirror property is not used, because the goal is to connect all mirrors with as few links as possible. The minimum number of links achievable is N-1.
      Specified by:
      getNumTargetLinks in class TopologyStrategy
      Parameters:
      n - (Network) the Network of mirrors
      Returns:
      the number of links for the network

    • getPredictedNumTargetLinks

      Specified by:

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      number of predicted total links
